---

title: " Some tips for my R toolkit"

author: "C Miller"

date: "2023-02-15"

categories: \[news, code, analysis\]

---

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
print(" SOME TIPS: ")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] " SOME TIPS: "
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print("Tip 1. storing a value in a variable")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "Tip 1. storing a value in a variable"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
x <- "Chantal"
print(x)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "Chantal"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print("Tip 2. The function 'c' ")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "Tip 2. The function 'c' "
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
y <- c(1,2,3,4,5,6)

# the function c will combine the values in the parentheses
print(y)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1 2 3 4 5 6
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print("Tip 3. Calculating a mean, the difference between text and numerical data")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "Tip 3. Calculating a mean, the difference between text and numerical data"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# cannot calculate mean("1", "2", "3", "4")

#convert to numerical data:

mean(y)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 3.5
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
print("Tip 4. How to read function documentation")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "Tip 4. How to read function documentation"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
#sample function

#function arguments

#sample(x, size, replace = FALSE, prob = NULL)

print("Calculating probability with a six-sided die")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "Calculating probability with a six-sided die"
```
:::
:::
